Key Arguments: The proposed legislation threatens freedom of speech, which is fundamental to a functional government and society.
The government may abuse the new powers to suppress conservative voices and opposition, similar to perceived actions in the US and Singapore.
The definition of 'disinformation' is subjective and could be used to target political opponents.
The government's claim that misinformation and disinformation threaten democracy is itself misinformation.
Freedom of speech should be absolute and protected under each state's Bill of Rights.
Notable Quotes: I have zero confidence in the government not abusing their newfound powers.
Misinformation and disinformation do not in any way pose a threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians.
